p: Oseltamivir is active against a variety of respiratory viruses, including influenza A and influenza B. Oseltamivir can decrease the severity and duration of the illness if started within 36 h of the onset of symptoms. The influenza neuraminidase enzyme is highly conserved, being common to type A H1N1, type A H2N2, type A H3N2, type A H5N1, and type B influenza viruses [ 40]. Interestingly, oseltamivir is also active against the strain that caused the 1918 pandemic [ 41].
